alert.note: Alert for Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 1:43PM PST until December 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. South to southwest winds gusting as high as 45 mph and up to 60 mph across the higher terrain. * WHERE...Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. This includes the communities of Chemult, Crescent, Beatty and Bly as well as highways 97, 31 and 140. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The bulk of the snow will fall Monday morning and afternoon. The strongest winds are expected across souther Klamath and western Lake Counties. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
